page.title: 20Farming in Ambergate
page.content: In the fields at{Lawn Farm}there were sheep and cows. When we walked into the farm drive we saw a fresh stream running down the side of it. They had sheared the sheep and filled the bags with wool. They have 110 acres of grass and have been living there for 3 years. They make silage and put it in a tower in the farmyard. A fan blows the grass through the pipes and into the shed where all the calves are .They have 3 sacks of corn and minerals a day.There were 85 lambs left and the others had been sold for meat. The parlour at Lawn Farm is not used. The farmer owns the farm next door and they milk the cows there. -------------------------------------- This area of{The Domesday Project was researched and compiled by Forms {3J, 3P}and{3G}of{PARKS MIDDLE SCHOOL, {BELPER, DERBYSHIRE. }
